definition: gluttonous/see 饕餮[tao1 tie4], zoomorphic mask motif
ferocious mythological animal, the fifth son of the dragon king/zoomorphic mask motif, found on Shang and Zhou ritual bronzes/gluttonous/sumptuous (banquet)
glutton/gourmand/by extension, person who is greedy for power, money, sex etc
great meal fit for dragon's son (idiom); sumptuous banquet

sentences.english: Sometimes he gets hungry and eats like a glutton.
sentences.chinese: 当他饿的时候，吃起东西来像个老饕。

sentences.english: You know, he can eat five big meals a day.
sentences.chinese: 他真是个老饕，你知道，一天可饱食五餐。

sentences.english: Right but pride comes first not gluttony.
sentences.chinese: 当他饿的时候，吃起东西来像个老饕。

sentences.english: Cities are gluttons when it comes to resources.
sentences.chinese: 城市是一个掠食资源的老饕。

sentences.english: This is the action film that put Statham on the map for most American moviegoers.
sentences.chinese: 这是一部把斯坦森介绍给大部分电影老饕的动作戏。

definition: gluttonous/see 饕餮[tao1 tie4], zoomorphic mask motif
plant mentioned in Book of Songs, uncertainly identified as carambola or star fruit (Averrhoa carambola)
surname Lou/one of the 28 lunar mansions in Chinese astronomy
to promote (to official position in former times)
